metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45061 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Python before 3.11.1. An unnecessary quadratic algorithm exists in one path when processing some inputs to the IDNA (RFC 3490) decoder, such that a crafted, unreasonably long name being presented to the decoder could lead to a CPU denial of service. Hostnames are often supplied by remote servers that could be controlled by a malicious actor; in such a scenario, they could trigger excessive CPU consumption on the client attempting to make use of an attacker-supplied supposed hostname. For example, the attack payload could be placed in the Location header of an HTTP response with status code 302. A fix is planned in 3.11.1, 3.10.9, 3.9.16, 3.8.16, and 3.7.16.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm13
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm13
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm13
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm13
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm13
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm13
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm13
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm13
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm13').
python3.4 package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
